perturbation.original_text: Stage 6: The service fee of NTD 3 million (SAY THREE MILLION ONLY) shall be paid after the Development Plan is adopted.
perturbation.changed_text: Stage 6: The service fee of NTD 3 million (SAY THREE MILLION ONLY) shall be paid after the Development Plan is conditionally adopted.
perturbation.explanation: By adding 'conditionally' adopted, it creates ambiguity about whether the payment is due if the plan adoption has caveats or requirements. This introduces a contradiction with Article V, which doesn't specify conditions for payment stages.

perturbation.original_text: In case the Contract cannot be performed due to any reason other than the architect herein, the client agrees the fees paid will not be refunded. In case the Contract cannot be performed due to the architect herein, the architect shall refund the fees paid in full without taking any interest to the client.
perturbation.changed_text: In case the Contract cannot be performed due to any reason other than the architect herein, the client agrees the fees paid will not be refunded. In case the Contract cannot be performed due to the architect herein, the architect shall refund 50% of the fees paid without taking any interest to the client.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states a full refund is due if the contract's failure is due to the architect. The modified text contradicts this by stating only 50% of the fees are to be refunded. This introduces uncertainty and a point of dispute.

perturbation.original_text: Article VII. Term Planned   Party B shall make the most economical and effective arrangement for Party A with respect to the project based on the principle of alignment with the plan progress of Party A. The term planned is stated as following: I. Topographic survey and measurement, geological drilling and program evaluation (about 1.0 months); II. Establishment of architectural development plan and business plan (about 2.0 months); III. Development of soil and water conservation plan (about 2.0 months); IV. Establishment of environmental impact assessment report (about 8.0 months); V. Review of development plan (containing soil and water conservation plan and environmental impact assessment report) (about 4 - 6 months);
perturbation.changed_text: Article VII. Term Planned   Party B shall make the most economical and effective arrangement for Party A with respect to the project based on the principle of alignment with the plan progress of Party A. The term planned is stated as following: I. Topographic survey and measurement, geological drilling and program evaluation (about 1.0 months); II. Establishment of architectural development plan and business plan (about 2.0 months); III. Development of soil and water conservation plan (about 2.0 months); IV. Establishment of environmental impact assessment report (about 8.0 months); V. Review of development plan (containing soil and water conservation plan and environmental impact assessment report) (about 2 - 3 months);
perturbation.explanation: The original states the Review of the development plan will take 4-6 months. The new section states it will take 2-3 months, which contradicts the original statement.
